p: COVID-19 is associated with a variety of central nervous system abnormalities, including stroke, encephalopathy, encephalitis, anosmia, anorexia, headache, nausea, and delerium [ 184]. A meta-analysis of literature from prior epidemics (SARS, Middle East respiratory syndrome) noted high frequencies of confusion, depressed mood, anxiety, impaired memory, and insomnia [ 149]. It has been proposed that the SARS-CoV-2 virus may invade the brainstem and alter functions of medullary cardiorespiratory centers [ 110].
